summary: Moved to Berlin as part of the Klarna's 2020 Graduate Program. Working on the _new_ consumer banking offering mostly as a Backend Engineer, focused on automating regulatory work.

Part of the development team of an internal product for Portugal's largest retailer, [Sonae MC](https://sonaemc.com/). Focused on developing an ML methodology for sales forecasting, and to predict the impact of price markdowns on medium-long term sales.

Part of the development team of [MELOA](https://www.ec-meloa.eu) as a member of the Computer Graphics and Information Systems (CGIS) department. Designed and developed a real time data streamer to authenticate, deliver, and load balance requests sent from IoT devices. Also designed a development kit for web apps that use MELOA's data and additional logic by providing a GraphQL API with multiple data sources.

Assisted professors during undergraduate classes part of FEUP's BSc. + MSc. in Computer Engineering program. Covered two courses: Computer Laboratory course (2017 and 2018) - dealt mostly with implementing low-level device drivers on a VM running Minix OS;  Computer Graphics - a course consisting mostly of building guided projects with WebGL to learn the basics of computer graphics algorithms and structures.
Spent early university summers designing an developing websites as pro bono work. Clients ranged from Music Producers to Agricultural Companies
